definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: This is a flag of Hong Kong . And the bauhinia flower stands for Hong Kong .
sentences.chinese: 这是一面香港的区旗，紫荆花是香港的象征。

sentences.english: The regional flag of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region is a red flag with a bauhinia highlighted by five star-tipped stamens.
sentences.chinese: 香港特别行政区的区旗是五星花蕊的紫荆花红旗。

sentences.english: The regional flag of HKSAR is a red flag with a bauhinia highlighted by five star-tipped stamens.
sentences.chinese: 香港特别行政区的区旗是五星花蕊的紫荆花红旗。

definition: special administrative region (SAR), of which there are two in the PRC: Hong Kong 香港 and Macau 澳門|澳门/refers to many different areas during late Qing, foreign occupation, warlord period and Nationalist government/refers to special zones in North Korea and Indonesia
Hong Kong Basic Law (in effect since the resumption of Chinese sovereignty in 1997)
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)

Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (abbr. for 中央人民政府駐香港特別行政區聯絡辦公室|中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室[Zhong1 yang1 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 fu3 Zhu4 Xiang1 gang3 Te4 bie2 Xing2 zheng4 qu1 Lian2 luo4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]) or the equivalent office in Macao
to raise a flag/to hoist a flag
